intro: Aspidostemon lucens, commonly known as the shining aspidostemon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, pale yellow or greenish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Aspidostemon lucens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
